bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October 13, 1900

div1.p: Reed returns to Washington for a meeting with the Surgeon General. He will continue on to Indianapolis for the American Public Health meeting. On November 1, Reed will leave for Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October 13, 1900
div1.p:
I will
leave Havana this
afternoon, by Ward
Line Steamer for
New York, and ought to
be able to reach
Washington by eve-
ning of 18th at most-
Am going up to the
see the Surgeon
General in order to
talk over matters-
Expect to be in Ind-
ianapolis on Octr
22nd, & 23rd & 24th.
Will get back to
W. by 25th & probably
sail from N.Y. on
Transport - leaving
about Novr 1st.
Boo! Boo! You sweet
babies that do and
that don't go to
School! General Wood will be
my fellow passenger-

Can't write more as
must dress for breakfast-
div1.closer:
Kiss fat little music & drawing
student & accept a large share
of love from your very bad
old Mr Mantee.
